title: NewsBreak: U.S. Oil Inventories Jumped by 5.7M Last Week: EIA
text:
NewsBreak: U.S. Oil Inventories Jumped by 5.7M Last Week: EIA

Commodities 1 hour ago (Oct 30, 2019 22:46)

© Reuters. Investing.com - Oil inventories in the U.S. rose by much more than expected last week, the Energy Information Administration reported Wednesday, sending oil prices further into the red. rose by 5.7 million barrels for the week ended Oct. 25, the EIA said. The market was looking for a rise of about 494,000 barrels, according to forecasts compiled by Investing.com. fell by about 3 million barrels, versus forecasts for drawdown of about 2.19 million barrels, while declined by 1 million barrels, compared with expectations for a drop of 2.35 million. were off 0.9%. London’s was down 1%.

NewsBreak: U.S. Oil Inventories Jumped by 5.7M Last Week: EIA
